snippet: Police officials said that Kurt R. Myers left no hints of his motivation in the shootings that killed four people across two communities on Wednesday.
abstract: Kurt R Meyers is shot and killed by a team of state and federal officers in a final fusillade the morning after his fatal rampage in two upstate New York towns; State Police officials say very little is clear about what drove Meyers to walk into two businesses in neighboring towns of Herkimer and Mohawk and shoot six people, seemingly at random, killing four.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Marc Santora from New York. Jamie Larson contributed reporting from Herkimer, N.Y., and Mohawk, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: Police officials said that Kurt R. Myers left no hints of his motivation in the shootings that killed four people across two communities on Wednesday.

headline.seo: Suspect in Upstate Shootings Is Killed, but Questions Remain
headline.main: Upstate Man Who Fatally Shot 4 Dies in Standoff; Motive Remains Unclear
headline.print_headline: Upstate Man Who Fatally Shot 4 Dies in Standoff; Motive Remains Unclear
